CLUE: Bird kept for eggs and meat
FOUND IN: Fowl (a general term used in the context of birds kept for egg laying or meat production)
Peony (flower, but peony is also associated with certain herbal extracts used in perfumery and traditional medicine)
Reverend (specifically used for Anglican and Presbyterian ministers, not a formal clerical position but respected within the community)
Molar hypoplasia (underdeveloped molars that may be more susceptible to wear and tearing)
Rumba: This dance originated from African drumming traditions brought to Cuba during colonial times and evolved into a vibrant expression of Cuban culture.
Close-knit community (metaphorical, represents a group that is closely connected)
Apricot: The fruit's golden skin matures into a warm pinkish tone with ripening.
